page.title: 11THE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: { A church stood on this site in Mediaeval times. It stood in the south -east corner of the present churchyard.This was demolished in 1850 and the present church constructed in 1851 by Lord Halifax,the major landowner in the area.Two stone heads were recovered from the original church and these were built, along with the Halifax coat of arms, into the church wall. A major earth movement in the early 1960's caused the graveyard to sink four feet,demolished the belfry and caused extensive damage inside the church.Cracks can still be seen crossing the floor of the church.Parts that fell from the church can be seen in the churchyard at the rear of the church.
